items.todoItem: As a beloved child of God, seek to become an imitator of God your Father who is kind, compassionate and forgiving.
Small children sometimes mimic their parents but as beloved children of God imitation is a necessity.
Live a life full of love, imitating God by loving others just as Jesus loved us.
Remember that Jesus gave His life for us as an offering and a sacrifice which was pleasing to God.
Remember that Jesus died in our place for our sins.
Know that true love gives oneself for others.
Offer fragrance to God by sacrificially living for others.
Know that God had an eternal purpose for the life and death of Jesus.
Know that God uses death with purpose for those impacted by it.
Do not compromise and give anyone any cause whatsoever to accuse you of sexual immorality, impurity, idolatry or greed.
Do not commit illicit sexual intercourse such as adultery, homosexuality, lesbianism, bestiality or incest.
Do not become defiled through moral impurity or sinfulness.
Do not commit idolatry; the desertion of the worship of the true God for the worship of idols.
Do not become obsessed with the possession of worldly things or the accumulation of wealth.
Know that neither sexual immorality, impurity, idolatry nor greed is to have any place whatsoever in the body of Christ.
Do not behave in a shameful or obscene manner.
Do not speak in an obscene manner or participate in foolish talking or jokes in bad taste.
Instead of speaking things that are not fitting, give thanks to God.
Know that there is not any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God for any immoral, impure or greedy person.
Let no one deceive you with vain words that all will go to heaven.
Know that God’s anger will come upon the children of disobedience because of immorality, impurity and greed.
Do not participate in the ways of the children of disobedience.
Remember that you once walked in darkness without understanding but now, in Christ, you have the light of life.
Walk as a child of God in the light of the knowledge of God.
Know that the evidence of the Holy Spirit in anyone is always goodness, righteousness and truth.
Walk in the light of God’s truth discerning and doing what is well pleasing to God.
Do not participate in works of darkness which are sinful and unprofitable but rather confront those who do and expose their shameful works convicting them of their fault.
Know that it is shameful even to talk about the things done privately and in secret by the children of disobedience.
Know that light confronts works of darkness exposing them for what they really are and convicting those who participate in them of their sin.
Know that God is saying to those who are spiritually dead to awake from their sleep and rise up from the dead so that Christ may shine the light of truth upon them and give them life.
Know that only the light of Jesus will stop you stumbling in the darkness and show you the right way to go.
Do not live foolishly.
Live wisely and walk surely.
Live carefully and use your time wisely to do good because the days in which we live are evil.
Know that the days in which we live are evil and many obstacles lie in the path of our opportunities to do good.
Do not be unwise but instead understanding and doing God’s will.
Do not become drunk with alcohol which is the type of depraved behaviour exhibited by those who carelessly indulge to riotous excess and who cannot be saved.
Don’t seek satisfaction through temptations like alcohol but instead be fulfilled by the Holy Spirit, speaking and singing to yourself and making melody in your heart to the Lord.
Continually give thanks to your heavenly Father for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Submit to one another in the fear of God.
Wives, submit to your own husbands as you would to the Lord.
Know that the husband is the head of the wife.
Know that Jesus is the head of the Church.
Know that Christ is the saviour of the body (the Church).
As the Church is subject to Christ, so let wives be to their own husbands in everything.
Husbands, love your wives just as Christ loved the Church and sacrificed Himself for it.
Know that Jesus sacrificed Himself in death for the Church.
Husbands, know that marriage is a sacrificial relationship.
Know that a husband is to love his wife whether or not he is loved in return.
The degree of the husband’s love for his wife is to match the degree of Christ’s sacrificial love for the Church.
Know that the Church is set apart exclusively and permanently for relationship with God.
Know that Christ cleansed and removed sin from the Church so that it would be presentable for eternity with God.
Know that the preaching of the Word of God is a cleansing and saving agent in the Church.

Know that the sacrifice of Jesus was so that He might sanctify His Church, having cleansed it with the purifying preaching of God’s Word, so that He might present it to Himself as a glorious Church that is holy and blameless in His sight.
Know that the Church is set apart by God for God.
Know that the cleansed Church is blameless in the sight of God.
Know that one day the Lord Jesus Christ will present the Church to Himself at the marriage supper of the Lamb in all splendor.
Husbands, it is your duty to love your wife as you love your own body.
Know that he who loves his wife loves himself.
Know that no man ever hated his own flesh but rather nourishes and cherishes it, just as Jesus does the Church.
Know that the Church is nourished and cherished by Jesus.
Remember that you are a member of the body of Christ (the Church).
Remember that you are part of the very flesh and bones of Jesus.
Know that because you are a member of the body of Christ, you are nourished and cherished by Jesus.
Know that when a man leaves his father and mother and gets married, that husband and wife become one flesh.
Know that Jesus left His Father and mother so that He could be joined to His Church as one flesh.
Husbands, love your own wife as yourself.
Know that love is the highest responsibility of every husband to his wife. No husband is exempt from this.
Wives, revere and honour your husband.
Know that respect and honour are the highest responsibility of every wife to her husband. No wife is exempt from this.
